instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 2850 Flex board no backlight
threads.message:
Hi.

Had this board on a shelf for a long time. I think I may have fixed PPBUS at some point.. Don't remember, it's mine.
Anyway, backlight is working but flex the board and the backlight goes off. I have tried replacing the backlight circuit, running wires all over the shop, poking the board in various places to find the spot, tried pissing about poking the GPU MUX which does turn backlight on and off but no more so than poking around the GPU reg or poking the 6259 or the USB HUB U3700. Fucking board's been poked more times than Louise Fokken. Tried a new LVDS connector and different screen right at the start too. Just can't locate it.

Bad via?
Bad ceramic cap?
Bad solder joint?

Guess it could be all or any, but if there is a common cause for this, please let me know.

threads.title: 2850 Flex board no backlight
threads.message:
Always has image, only backlight goes off?
Post BKLT_EN, LVDS_BKL_PWM_RC, LCD_BKLT_EN and SMC_LID for no backlight case.

threads.title: 2850 Flex board no backlight
threads.message: U9600 MUX problem. Very thoroughly remove the edge bonding and reflow MUX.

threads.title: 2850 Flex board no backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 29759"]Always has image, only backlight goes off?
Post BKLT_EN, LVDS_BKL_PWM_RC, LCD_BKLT_EN and SMC_LID for no backlight case.
[/QUOTE]

Actually, if I flex the board in different ways sometimes it turns off backlight and sometimes the image too.


[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 29777"]U9600 MUX problem. Very thoroughly remove the edge bonding and reflow MUX. [/QUOTE]
I'll try that today.


[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 29759"]Post BKLT_EN, LVDS_BKL_PWM_RC, LCD_BKLT_EN and SMC_LID for no backlight case.
[/QUOTE]

I've not tested it. I'll flow the mux first.

threads.title: 2850 Flex board no backlight
threads.message: I fucked it up and knocked the fucking chip. What's the pin pitch / ball size for these chips? Need to reball it :(

threads.title: 2850 Flex board no backlight
threads.message: 0.3mm, All the stencils i have are rubbish so i have to do Gmux's by hand with solder balls :(
